it.jrc.lt.core.component.morphology

Class AbstractMorphology

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.jrc.lt.core.component.Component
      • it.jrc.lt.core.component.morphology.AbstractMorphology
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Storable

    public abstract class AbstractMorphology
extends Component
    This class the a base abstract class for morphology components. It provides methods, which allow search for a single word whether it is covered by the morphology and method for applying the morphological analysis to the given text.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class it.jrc.lt.core.component.Component

      • search

        public abstract AbstractDisjunctionOfMorphologyItems search(char[] word)
        Returns morphological information associated with the input word.
        Parameters:
        word - input string
        Returns:
        a disjunction of AbstractMorphologyItem objects which represents the morphological information associated with the input word, or null if the input word is not covered by the morphology.

      • search

        Returns morphological information associated with the input word.

        Returns:

        public abstract java.lang.String getPartOfSpeech(char[] word)
        Returns part-of-speech information associated with the input word.

        Returns:

      • getPartOfSpeech

        public java.lang.String getPartOfSpeech(java.lang.String word)
        Returns part-of-speech information associated with the input word.
        Parameters:
        word - input string (as String object)
        Returns:
        a String object which represents the part-of-speech information associated with the input word (each character stands for a single part-of-speech), or null if the input word is not covered by the morphology.

      • getLemma

        public abstract java.lang.String[] getLemma(char[] word)
        Returns lemma information associated with the input word.
        Parameters:
        word - input string (as character array)
        Returns:
        an array of lemmas associated with the input word (each character stands for a single part-of-speech), or null if the input word is not covered by the morphology.

      • getLemma

        public java.lang.String[] getLemma(java.lang.String word)
        Returns lemma information associated with the input word.
        Parameters:
        word - input string (as String object)
        Returns:
        an array of lemmas associated with the input word, or null if the input word is not covered by the morphology.

      • swithOffCaseSensitiveMode

        public void swithOffCaseSensitiveMode()
        Switches the case-insensitive mode on, i.e., the input text/word is additionally downcased if the original form is not covered by the morphology. The lexicon entries themselves are not downcased or affected in any other way at any time.

      • switchOnCaseSensitiveMode

        public void switchOnCaseSensitiveMode()
        Switches to the case-sensitive mode.

      • isCaseSensitive

        public boolean isCaseSensitive()
        For checking if the case-sensitive mode is on
        Returns:
        true if the morphology component is in the case-sensitive mode, or false otherwise.

      • returnOutputForUnknownWords

        public void returnOutputForUnknownWords()
        Switches on the option of returning output structures for unknown words (not covered by the morphology). Such structures would for instance have the POS attribute set to 'unknown' or so.

      • doNotReturnOutputForUnknownWords

        public void doNotReturnOutputForUnknownWords()
        Switches the option of returning output structures for unknown words (not covered by the morphology) off,

      • producesOutputForUnknownWords

        public boolean producesOutputForUnknownWords()
        For checking if the option of returning output structures for unknown words is on.
        Returns:
        true if the option of returning output structures for unknown words is on or false otherwise.

      • findMatch

        public abstract java.util.ArrayList<AbstractDisjunctionOfMorphologyItems> findMatch(java.util.ArrayList<AbstractTokenItem> tokens,
                                                                                    char[] text)
        Applies the morphology to a given input text, and returns an array list of disjunctions of morphology items (AbstractMorphologyItem), where each such disjunction represents a match (possibly with more than one reading) in the input text at a given position. See also AbstractMorphologyItem. See also AbstractDisjunctionOfMorphologyItems .
        Parameters:
        tokens - an array list of token items (See also AbstractTokenItem )
        text - character array storing the input text
        Returns:
        an array list of disjunctions of morphology items (AbstractMorphologyItem objects), where each disjunction represents a match at a given position

      • findMatch

        public java.util.ArrayList<AbstractDisjunctionOfMorphologyItems> findMatch(java.util.ArrayList<AbstractTokenItem> tokens,
                                                                           java.lang.String text)
        Applies the morphology to a given input text, and returns an array list of disjunctions of morphology items (AbstractMorphologyItem), where each such disjunction represents a match (possibly with more than one reading) in the input text at a given position. See also AbstractMorphologyItem. See also AbstractDisjunctionOfMorphologyItems .
        Parameters:
        tokens - an array list of token items (See also AbstractTokenItem )
        text - string representing the input text
        Returns:
        an array list of disjunctions of morphology items (AbstractMorphologyItem objects), where each disjunction represents a match at a given position
